title: Designing a Science Learning Experience Evaluation System Using Wearable Devices

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Students conduct science experiments in a VR-based laboratory, collecting real-time physiological data via wearable devices. The data is utilized to analyze learning focus and engagement levels.

learning_goals: Students can track their learning concentration levels with over 80% accuracy by analyzing wearable device data while performing science experiments in VR simulation environments
Learners can provide immediate feedback (formative assessment) and suggest improvement plans based on physiological data collected at 6.25-minute intervals
Classify personalized optimal learning durations (sustainable concentration periods) into three types using wearable device data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
